title: Orange Cup Cakes
ingredients:
94gm unsalted butter

163gm granulated sugar
1 medium orange zested
175gm SR Flour
2 medium eggs
1/2 tspn vanilla essence
100gm milk
pinch salt
Frosting
200gm cream cheese
80gm unsalted butter
100gm icing sugar
20gm fresh orange juice
1 medium orange zested
orange flesh for decoration
method: Pre heat oven 180ºC.
Melt butter over a double boiler (or in MW) until liquid.
Allow to cool.
In a small bowl add sugar and orange zest; rub zest through sugar to release the oil and set aside.
Using whisk or hand beaters, beat orange sugar and eggs until pale and fluffy.
Add vanilla, milk and cooled butter and beat until combined.
Add SR flour to wet ingredients, using a spatula to gently fold through, being careful not to over mix.
Line baking tray with cup cake cases (I used larger cases which made only six cakes).
Fill cases to 1/2 full.
Bake 20-25mins.
Time will depend on size of cakes.
Test with a metal skewer.
Set aside to cool.
Frosting
Leave butter and cream cheese to come up to room temperature.
Cream together butter and cheese.
Add icing sugar beat well until smooth.
Add orange juice and zest mix well.
Chill frosting in fridge to firm up before icing.
Decorate with fresh orange slices or use some dried orange pieces from ‘Lazy Acres’ or grated chocolate.
